Module io.github.wander.inventorymanager
Package io.github.wander.inventorymanager

Class ProdController

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.wander.inventorymanager.ProdController
  • public class ProdController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all logic involved with the execution of the product view
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jordan Neuenschwander

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addView​(Inventory newInventory)
      This method sets up the view to be in the state where it has the add product functionality It sets a flag so the controller knows which mode the view is in and creates a copy of the Inventory model used by the MainController
      private void clearPage()
      Clears the product view of all input and sets the view to its default state
      private void initialize()
      This method initializes the list of associated parts to empty and binds the table columns to the data they will be displaying.
      void modifyView​(int index, Product modifyProduct, Inventory newInventory)
      This method sets up the view to be in a "modify product" state.
      (package private) void onClickCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Asks the user if they would like to return to the MainView and goes to the main view upon confirmation
      (package private) void onClickPartAdd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method adds the part that is selected in the parts table to the associated parts table
      (package private) void onClickRemoveAssociated​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method removes the currently selected associated part from the associated parts table
      (package private) void onClickSaveProd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method creates a new Product object using the user input and the data in the associated parts table.
      (package private) void partSearch()
      This method searches the parts table for a user input string It can find partial or exact part matches and exact part id matches
      private void refreshTables()
      Refreshes the data presented in the tables

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        This method initializes the list of associated parts to empty and binds the table columns to the data they will be displaying.

      • refreshTables

        private void refreshTables()
        Refreshes the data presented in the tables

      • clearPage

        private void clearPage()
        Clears the product view of all input and sets the view to its default state

      • addView

        public void addView​(Inventory newInventory)
        This method sets up the view to be in the state where it has the add product functionality It sets a flag so the controller knows which mode the view is in and creates a copy of the Inventory model used by the MainController
        Parameters:
        newInventory - the Inventory to be copied into member variable inventory

      • modifyView

        public void modifyView​(int index,
                       Product modifyProduct,
                       Inventory newInventory)
        This method sets up the view to be in a "modify product" state. It prints the data stored in a Product object to the relevant text boxes and initializes the associated parts table with the associatedParts list from the product Sets a flag so the controller knows what mode the view is in.
        Parameters:
        index - the index where the modifyProduct is located
        modifyProduct - the product to be modified
        newInventory - the current inventory

      • onClickCancel

        void onClickCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Asks the user if they would like to return to the MainView and goes to the main view upon confirmation
        Parameters:
        event - the event thrown when the cancel button is clicked
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - NullPointerException when the FXMLLoader can not find the fxml file
        java.lang.Exception - IOException if FXMLLoader attempts to load a null value

      • onClickPartAdd

        void onClickPartAdd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method adds the part that is selected in the parts table to the associated parts table
        Parameters:
        event - event thrown when the add button under the parts table is clicked

      • onClickRemoveAssociated

        void onClickRemoveAssociated​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This method removes the currently selected associated part from the associated parts table
        Parameters:
        event - event thrown when the removed associated parts button is clicked

      • onClickSaveProd

        void onClickSaveProd​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This method creates a new Product object using the user input and the data in the associated parts table. User input is validated before it is accepted. It then instructs the MainController to either add this product or update an existing product in the list of all products. It then changes the view to the main view and resets the product view to its default state
        Parameters:
        event - the event thrown when a user clicks the save button
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - NullPointerException when the FXMLLoader can not find the fxml file
        java.lang.Exception - IOException if FXMLLoader attempts to load a null value

      • partSearch

        void partSearch()
        This method searches the parts table for a user input string It can find partial or exact part matches and exact part id matches
